Name: Sodium nitrate
Description: Added to processed meats to stop bacterial growth. Linked to cancer in humans. (Worst Offender)
Original Description: Added to processed meats to stop bacterial growth. Linked to cancer in humans. (Worst Offender)

Name: Sulfites
Description: Used to keep prepared foods fresh. Can cause breathing difficulties in those sensitive to the ingredient.
Original Description: Used to keep prepared foods fresh. Can cause breathing difficulties in those sensitive to the ingredient.

Name: Azodicarbonamide
Description: Used in bagels and buns. Can cause asthma.
Original Description: Used in bagels and buns. Can cause asthma.

Name: Potassium bromate
Description: Added to breads to increase volume. Linked to cancer in humans.
Original Description: Added to breads to increase volume. Linked to cancer in humans.

Name: Propyl gallate
Description: Added to fat-containing products. Linked to cancer in humans
Original Description: Added to fat-containing products. Linked to cancer in humans

Name: BHA/BHT
Description: A fat preservative, used in foods to extend shelf life. Linked to cancerous tumor growth.
Original Description: A fat preservative, used in foods to extend shelf life. Linked to cancerous tumor growth.

Name: Propylene glycol
Description: Better known as antifreeze. Thickens dairy products and salad dressing. Deemed ‘generally’ safe by FDA.
Original Description: Better known as antifreeze. Thickens dairy products and salad dressing. Deemed ‘generally’ safe by FDA.

Name: Butane
Description: Put in chicken nuggets to keep them tasting fresh. A known carcinogen.
Original Description: Put in chicken nuggets to keep them tasting fresh. A known carcinogen.

Name: Monosodium glutamate (MSG)
Description: Flavor enhancer (think "Umami") - originally with bad rep but increasingly shown to be harmless. Occurs naturally in a number of products
Original Description: Flavor enhancer that can cause headaches. Linked in animal studies to nerve damage, heart problems and seizures.

Name: Disodium inosinate
Description: In snack foods. Contains MSG.
Original Description: In snack foods. Contains MSG.

Name: Disodium guanylate
Description: Used in snack foods, and contains MSG.
Original Description: Also used in snack foods, and contains MSG.

Name: Enriched flour
Description: Used in many snack foods. A refined starch that is made from toxic ingredients.
Original Description: Used in many snack foods. A refined starch that is made from toxic ingredients.

Name: Recombinant Bovine Growth Hormone (rBGH)
Description: Geneticially-engineered version of natural growth hormone in cows. Boosts milk production in cows. Contains high levels of IGF-1, which is thought cause various types of cancer.
Original Description: Geneticially-engineered version of natural growth hormone in cows. Boosts milk production in cows. Contains high levels of IGF-1, which is thought cause various types of cancer.

Name: Refined vegetable oil
Description: Includes soybean oil, corn oil, safflower oil, canola oil, and peanut oil. High in omega-6 fats, which are thought to cause heart disease and cancer.
Original Description: Includes soybean oil, corn oil, safflower oil, canola oil, and peanut oil. High in omega-6 fats, which are thought to cause heart disease and cancer.

Name: Sodium benzoate
Description: Used as a preservative in salad dressing and carbonated beverages. A known carcinogen and may cause damage our DNA.
Original Description: Used as a preservative in salad dressing and carbonated beverages. A known carcinogen and may cause damage our DNA.

Name: Brominated vegetable oil
Description: Keeps flavor oils in soft drinks suspended. Bromate is a poison and can cause organ damage and birth defects. Not required to be listed on food labels.
Original Description: Keeps flavor oils in soft drinks suspended. Bromate is a poison and can cause organ damage and birth defects. Not required to be listed on food labels.

Name: Propyl gallate
Description: Found in meats, popcorn, soup mixes and frozen dinners. Shown to cause cancer in rats. Banned in some countries. Deemed safe by FDA.
Original Description: Found in meats, popcorn, soup mixes and frozen dinners. Shown to cause cancer in rats. Banned in some countries. Deemed safe by FDA.

Name: Olestra
Description: Fat-like substance that is unabsorbed by the body. Used in place of natural fats in some snack foods. Can cause digestive problems, and also not healthy for the heart.
Original Description: Fat-like substance that is unabsorbed by the body. Used in place of natural fats in some snack foods. Can cause digestive problems, and also not healthy for the heart.

Name: Carrageenan
Description: Stabilizer and thickening agent used in many prepared foods, derived from algae.
Original Description: Stabilizer and thickening agent used in many prepared foods. Can cause ulcers and cancer.

Name: Polysorbate 60
Description: A thickener that is used in baked goods. Can cause cancer in laboratory animals.
Original Description: A thickener that is used in baked goods. Can cause cancer in laboratory animals.

Name: Camauba wax
Description: Used in chewing gums and to glaze certain foods. Can cause cancer and tumors.
Original Description: Used in chewing gums and to glaze certain foods. Can cause cancer and tumors.

Name: Magnesium sulphate
Description: Used to make tofu, and as a magnesium supplement
Original Description: Used in tofu, and can cause cancer in laboratory animals.

Name: Chlorine dioxide
Description: Used in bleaching flour. Can cause tumors and hyperactivity in children.
Original Description: Used in bleaching flour. Can cause tumors and hyperactivity in children.

Name: Paraben
Description: Used to stop mold and yeast forming in foods. Can disrupt hormones in the body, and could be linked to breast cancer.
Original Description: Used to stop mold and yeast forming in foods. Can disrupt hormones in the body, and could be linked to breast cancer.

Name: Sodium carboxymethyl cellulose
Description: Used as a thickener in salad dressings. Could cause cancer in high quantities.
Original Description: Used as a thickener in salad dressings. Could cause cancer in high quantities.

Name: Aluminum
Description: A preservative in some packaged foods that can cause cancer.
Original Description: A preservative in some packaged foods that can cause cancer.

Name: Saccharin
Description: Carcinogen found to cause bladder cancer in rats. (Worst Offender)
Original Description: Carcinogen found to cause bladder cancer in rats. (Worst Offender)

Name: Aspartame
Description: An excitotoxin and thought to be a carcinogen. Can cause dizziness, headaches, blurred vision and stomach problems.
Original Description: An excitotoxin and thought to be a carcinogen. Can cause dizziness, headaches, blurred vision and stomach problems.

Name: High fructose corn syrup
Description: Sweetener made from corn starch. Made from genetically-modified corn. Causes obesity, diabetes, heart problems, arthritis and insulin resistance.
Original Description: Sweetener made from corn starch. Made from genetically-modified corn. Causes obesity, diabetes, heart problems, arthritis and insulin resistance.

Name: Acesulfame potassium
Description: Used with other artificial sweeteners in diet sodas and ice cream. Linked to lung and breast tumors in rats.
Original Description: Used with other artificial sweeteners in diet sodas and ice cream. Linked to lung and breast tumors in rats.

Name: Sucralose
Description: Splenda. Can cause swelling of liver and kidneys and a shrinkage of the thymus gland.
Original Description: Splenda. Can cause swelling of liver and kidneys and a shrinkage of the thymus gland.

Name: Agave nectar
Description: Sweetener derived from a cactus. Contains high levels of fructose, which causes insulin resistance, liver disease and inflammation of body tissues.
Original Description: Sweetener derived from a cactus. Contains high levels of fructose, which causes insulin resistance, liver disease and inflammation of body tissues.

Name: Bleached starch
Description: Can be used in many dairy products. Thought to be related to asthma and skin irritations.
Original Description: Can be used in many dairy products. Thought to be related to asthma and skin irritations.

Name: Tert butylhydroquinone
Description: Used to preserve fish products. Could cause stomach tumors at high doses.
Original Description: Used to preserve fish products. Could cause stomach tumors at high doses.

Name: Red #40
Description: Found in many foods to alter color. All modern food dyes are derived from petroleum. A carcinogen that is linked to cancer in some studies. Also can cause hyperactivity in children. Banned in some European countries. (Worst Offender)
Original Description: Found in many foods to alter color. All modern food dyes are derived from petroleum. A carcinogen that is linked to cancer in some studies. Also can cause hyperactivity in children. Banned in some European countries. (Worst Offender)

Name: Blue #1
Description: Used in bakery products, candy and soft drinks. Can damage chromosomes and lead to cancer.
Original Description: Used in bakery products, candy and soft drinks. Can damage chromosomes and lead to cancer.

Name: Blue #2
Description: Used in candy and pet food beverages. Can cause brain tumors
Original Description: Used in candy and pet food beverages. Can cause brain tumors

Name: Citrus red #1
Description: Sprayed on oranges to make them look ripe. Can damage chromosomes and lead to cancer.
Original Description: Sprayed on oranges to make them look ripe. Can damage chromosomes and lead to cancer.

Name: Citrus red #2
Description: Used to color oranges. Can cause cancer if you eat the peel.
Original Description: Used to color oranges. Can cause cancer if you eat the peel.

Name: Green #3
Description: Used in candy and beverages. May cause bladder tumors.
Original Description: Used in candy and beverages. May cause bladder tumors.

Name: Yellow #5
Description: Used in desserts, candy and baked goods.Thought to cause kidney tumors, according to some studies.
Original Description: Used in desserts, candy and baked goods.Thought to cause kidney tumors, according to some studies.

Name: Yellow #6
Description: A carcinogen used in sausage, beverages and baked goods. Thought to cause kidney tumors, according to some studies.
Original Description: A carcinogen used in sausage, beverages and baked goods. Thought to cause kidney tumors, according to some studies.

Name: Red #2
Description: A food coloring that may cause both asthma and cancer.
Original Description: A food coloring that may cause both asthma and cancer.

Name: Red #3
Description: A carcinogen. that is added to cherry pie filling, ice cream and baked goods. May cause nerve damage and thyroid cancer.
Original Description: A carcinogen. that is added to cherry pie filling, ice cream and baked goods. May cause nerve damage and thyroid cancer.

Name: Caramel coloring
Description: In soft drinks, sauces, pastries and breads. When made with ammonia, it can cause cancer in mice. Food companies not required to disclose if this ingredient is made with ammonia.
Original Description: In soft drinks, sauces, pastries and breads. When made with ammonia, it can cause cancer in mice. Food companies not required to disclose if this ingredient is made with ammonia.

Name: Brown HT
Description: Used in many packaged foods. Can cause hyperactivity in children, asthma and cancer.
Original Description: Used in many packaged foods. Can cause hyperactivity in children, asthma and cancer.

Name: Orange B
Description: A food dye that is used in hot dog and sausage casings. High doses are bad for the liver and bile duct.
Original Description: A food dye that is used in hot dog and sausage casings. High doses are bad for the liver and bile duct.

Name: Bixin
Description: Food coloring that can cause hyperactivity in children and asthma.
Original Description: Food coloring that can cause hyperactivity in children and asthma.

Name: Norbixin
Description: Food coloring that can cause hyperactivity in children and asthma.
Original Description: Food coloring that can cause hyperactivity in children and asthma.

Name: Annatto
Description: Food coloring that can cause hyperactivity in children and asthma.
Original Description: Food coloring that can cause hyperactivity in children and asthma.
